utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The interface is pretty simple. You put your horizontal X coordinate here, vertical Y coordinate here. When you’re happy with those, you press this button.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you’ll never guess who I just found online. Hey!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nice shot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Eh, his giant head did most of the work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very mature. You’re lucky I’m out of silly string. As I was saying, Leonard, you’ll never guess who I just found online. Professor Proton.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. He’s still alive?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s Professor Proton?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He was the host of this great… Hey!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes! Sorry, tell me about Professor Proton.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Proton hosted my favourite science show when I was a child. I never missed an episode. He demonstrated scientific principles using everyday objects.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, so cute when you use the word cool wrong. Like when kids say pasghetti.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear lord, Leonard, look. He’s still available for parties and events. We should hire him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hire him to do what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, whatever we want. Hang out, do experiments, make him take 12 pictures with us so we can make a calendar.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It would be pretty awesome to hang out with him. I just used awesome wrong, didn’t I?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m e-mailing him right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you remember his old theme song?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course I do.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Grab your goggles, put your lab coat on, here he comes, Professor Proton.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, I just found out I have to be at the telescope lab all weekend. Any chance you and Bernadette could take care of my dog?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t you put her in a kennel?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why don’t you put your mother in a home?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: To be honest, she’d do better in the kennel. I’ll talk to Bernie. I’m sure it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s happening. Leonard, it’s happening. Professor Proton is coming to our house.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean the guy who used to host that lame kids show?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you just got yourself uninvited. See? I told you I’d find a tactful way to do that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How’d you get him to come to your house?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As Professor Proton always says, there is no problem you can’t solve if you use your noggin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And he wrote him a cheque.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, that, too. Big cheque.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uncle Howard. Cinnamon’s here for her sleepover party.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know if you had a stroke, she’d eat you, right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And it would be my pleasure to be her num-num.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, so what do I need to know to take care of her?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s very simple. For breakfast, she has an egg-white frittata. Feel free to give her a choice of home fries or an English muffin, but not both. We’re watching our weight. Uh, for dinner, something simple, a veal chop, some scampi, whatever you like.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Classy dog.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes. Also, don’t forget to close the toilet or she’ll drink out of it.

utterance.speaker: Howatd
utterance.content: I feel for ya. I’ve got a psychotic mommy, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Leonard, are you in bed?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: I can’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I can, so shut up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Do you realize that in less than nine hours, Arthur Jeffries, aka Professor Proton, will be in our apartment?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you know that if you stay up all night, you’re gonna be sleepy tomorrow. And a sleepy Sheldon is a cranky Sheldon. And a cranky Sheldon is actually no different than a regular Sheldon. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: I’m thinking of wearing a tuxedo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not ridiculous. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Do you have cufflinks?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Ah, just as well. Where can you rent a tuxedo at three o’clock in the morning?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, Professor Proton. Nice to meet you, Professor Proton. Nice to meet you, Professor Proton. Nice to meet you, Prof… Ow! Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: I still can’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She really tuckered herself out at the park, huh?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, you two were so cute playing together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was kind of fun throwing a ball and not having anyone laugh at me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And you were sweet not to throw it too far so she didn’t wear out her tiny legs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I was doing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, there were a few moments today when I almost felt like we were a little family.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. I never thought of myself as a mom, but when the three of us were out there having fun, I felt like maybe someday we could do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course we can. Especially if our baby’s as calm and quiet as little Cinna… Son of a bitch, she’s gone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know, she didn’t leave a note.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, you were the one who was supposed to put her back in the stroller.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I wasn’t. You were.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, you were!.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you throw like a girl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m getting worried.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Relax, Sheldon, he’s only a few minutes late.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Proton was never late when he was on TV. You know, every day, four o’clock, he was there. Unless tornadoes were ripping apart East Texas, in which case we’d join him in progress. It’s him. Hello. Well, I see. Yes. All right, we can come get you. Yeah, well, see you soon. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The third floor landing. The poor old guy’s been walking up the stairs for half an hour. It’s really you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mr. Jeffries, I am so sorry. We should’ve told you about the broken elevator.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I agree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Proton, it’s an honour to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Just, just call me Arthur.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you hear that? Professor Proton said I should call him Arthur. That means we’re friends.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No. A friend would’ve, would’ve told me about the elevator.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at me. I can get as close to you as I want without my mom saying it’s going to ruin my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Is, uh, is he dangerous?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, he’s a genius.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: That doesn’t answer my question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mr. Jeffries, I’m, I’m Leonard. This is my girlfriend, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, I hope I haven’t, uh, kept the kids waiting too long for, for the show.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, there are no kids. No, the, the show’s for me. Come on. I’ll race ya, Arthur.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Is the, is the blonde girl really your, your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: You’re the genius.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, do you do a lot of appearances like this?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: It, it’s hard to say. I’m, I’m still trying to figure out what, what th, what this is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We just wanted to hang out with you and maybe learn a little about your life.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, there, there really isn’t too much to tell. After the TV show was, was cancelled, nobody in the scientific world would, uh, would take me seriously. So I was forced to do these, uh, children’s parties to, to make a living.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s too bad. But still, working with kids, it must be rewarding.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: You, you get bit a lot. Let me see if, if I have this straight. You, you two are, are physicists, and you, and you want me to do a children’s science show?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. And if there’s time, take 12 pictures with us in seasonal clothing.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: You know, I’m a real scientist. I, I have a PhD from Cornell University.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s great. Did you bring your puppet?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No, no. I, I hate that puppet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no. How could anybody hate Gino the Neutrino? It’s nice, huh? I got him for 20 bucks on eBay. Including the shipping!

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I’m, I’m awake, right? Th, this is happening?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Cinnamon!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cinnamon!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, maybe she doesn’t recognize her name because of Raj’s accent.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good thinking. Cinnamon, come to Daddy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (likewise)
utterance.content: Cinnamon. Where are you, my little lamb chop?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When this all blows over, remember that voice. It’s kind of a turn-on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It turns you on when I sound like Raj?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cinnamon!

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Okay, as, as I put the egg on top, and, and the flame goes out and, and, and the air pressure decreases in, in the flask, what do you think will happen?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think I know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s gonna get sucked in. It’s going to get sucked in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I didn’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: See, I’m not a scientist like them.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I, I figured that out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Potato clock. Do potato clock.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I, I power a clock with a, with a potato.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up. You can do that? I mean, wouldn’t that solve the world’s energy crisis?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No. Look, guys, keep your money. I, I think, uh, I, I think I’m done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, well what’s wrong? Is she upsetting you? Because I can make her go away.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No, she, she’s the only reason I’ve, I’ve stayed this long.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I don’t know. I think I’m just, I, I just, I just don’t want to be Professor Proton any more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, how can you say that? Professor Proton’s the best.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: What, what has it ever gotten me? I mean, I’m, I’m an 83-year-old man who has potatoes in, in his suitcase. Other scientists think, think I’m a joke. And the, the puppeteer who did, who did Gino, well, he also did my wife.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mr. Jeffries, I need to show you something. :14:11,446

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry to hear about your troubles.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But if you don’t mind me asking, uh, the potato clock, how does it work? Is it a trick clock or a trick potato?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: What do you two talk about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wrote a fan letter to you when I was a child in Texas, and you sent this autographed picture back to me. Do you remember that?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I’ll, I’ll give you a hint. I have a bracelet with my own address on it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, anyway, um, you may find this hard to believe, but I didn’t have any friends growing up.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No, I, I get that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But, um, I did have you. And every day at four o’clock, you’d come to my house on Channel 68, and we’d do science together. If it hadn’t been for you, well, who knows what would’ve become of me? You know? Instead of a world-class physicist, I could’ve wound up as a hobo. Or a surgeon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I bet there are important discoveries being made every day because you inspired millions of kids to pursue science. In a way, their discoveries are your discoveries.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s true. A generation of young scientists are standing on your shoulders.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, thank, thank you, guys. That, that, that means a lot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s important you know how much you mean to us.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Arthur, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I’m having a problem with my pacemaker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll, I’ll call for help.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Any chance we could plug it into the potato?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello? What do you mean, you found my dog? She’s with my friends. Is she okay? Oh, thank you. Uh, just text me your address, I’m on my way. Oh, and if she’s hungry, go ahead and feed her. But do not give her anything starchy. She’s having risotto for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: Your vitals are stable, but let’s take you in for some tests just to be safe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want one of us to go with you in the ambulance?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: He’s not a relative, he’s not allowed, right?

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: No, that’s not a rule. He can go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I can’t catch a break today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’ll pack up your stuff and meet you at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry things turned out this way.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, at, at this point, I’m just glad someone’s carrying me down the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Met my childhood hero, now I get to ride in an ambulance. Boy, if we can get him to do that calendar, this’ll be the best day ever.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can’t believe we lost her. What was I thinking? I’d be a terrible mom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, maybe with the first one. But kids are like pancakes. The first one’s always a throwaway. How’s this look?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s fine. Where’d you get that picture of her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not her. I just googled foo-foo little dogs. It’s Raj. Stay quiet. Hey, bad timing. Bernadette just took Cinnamon out for a walk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hmm. Interesting. Did they take a walk down Liars’ Lane?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A lane frequented by liars. Like you, you big liar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You have her?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, thank God she’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I trusted you, and you let me down. The poor thing’s been shaking for hours.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hang on, you’ve had her for hours?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes. I picked her up, and then we both went for massages to try and calm down. And then we got Pinkberry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So you knew she was okay, and you couldn’t pick up the phone to tell us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I, I thought about…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t well me, mister. We’ve been worried sick. She could have been dead for all we knew. You should be ashamed of yourself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry. I, I just…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry’s not good enough. Maybe you need to take some time and think about what you’ve done.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nice guilt trip. You are gonna be an amazing mom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur. Happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr, purr, purr.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon. That, that was very nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Want me to sing it again?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No. The fourth, the fourth time was, was the charm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There anything I can get for you? Some apple juice? Uh, some Jell-O?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: No. No, thank you. But I, I do, I do have a favour to, to ask.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Name it.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, I’m, I’m booked to do a children’s party tomorrow, and, um, frankly I, you know, I, I don’t feel up to it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you’re not. You look awful.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Thank you. Anyway, uh, I mean, you know my act better than anybody. I was, I was hoping that maybe, you know, maybe you’d fill in for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you saying that you want me to be Professor Proton?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, my. What an honour. Oh, this is like being asked to ascend Mount Olympus and dine with the gods.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Or a Korean family in Alhambra.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But they’ll know I’m not you. Should I call myself Professor Proton, Jr.?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, in a way it’s like I’m your son.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: What, Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Father.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Sure, what the hell.
